text: A woman who says Chicago police pulled her from a car and placed a knee on her neck asked the city to drop disorderly conduct charges that were filed after the incident. https://t.co/rMUeZeo71d

text: Indiana Dunes beaches are seeing large crowds — including an influx of Illinois residents. "Every day is like the Fourth of July," one police chief said. https://t.co/8W0KPZMurH

text: Chicagoans can now legally carry away — and order — cocktails from local bars. https://t.co/c063wtnBdU

name: chicagotribune
text: It’s not exactly quaffing hurricanes on Bourbon Street, but Chicagoans can now legally carry away cocktails from local bars. Takeaways will be legal for a year,  set to automatically lapse in June 2021. https://t.co/hAPC8s4Tpo

name: chicagotribune
text: In a new book, former national security adviser John Bolton describes several episodes where President Trump expressed willingness to "give personal favors to dictators he liked." https://t.co/HTdostZadX

name: chicagotribune
text:
The Justice Department asked a federal judge to halt the publication of John Bolton’s book, saying that it contained classified information even as details emerged from it. 

From The New York Times. https://t.co/Wmw6UiOe2J
